Ageratum conyzoides.description: A fast-growing invasive weed known for its blue-purple flowers. It competes with crops and can alter ecosystems.

Artemisia vulgaris.description: Commonly known as mugwort, this aromatic plant can rapidly spread and displace native vegetation.

Asparagus officinalis.description: A cultivated vegetable that can escape into the wild and grow aggressively, forming dense stands.

Bidens pilosa.description: Also called Spanish needle, this weed spreads rapidly and is difficult to eradicate once established.

Cardiospermum halicacabum.description: Known as balloon vine, this fast-growing climber can smother native plants and spread along fences and trees.

Chloris barbata.description: An invasive grass species that competes with native grasses and alters the natural habitat structure.

Chromolaena odorata.description: A major invasive shrub known as Siam weed; it forms dense thickets that suppress native flora.

Heliotropium indicum.description: Commonly found in disturbed areas, this weed produces allelopathic compounds harmful to nearby plants.

Imperata cylindrica.description: One of the world’s worst invasive grasses; forms dense mats and spreads rapidly through rhizomes.

Lantana camara.description: A notorious invasive shrub with colorful flowers; toxic to livestock and forms dense, impenetrable thickets.

Leucaena leucocephala.description: A fast-growing tree used for fodder and erosion control, but invades forests and grasslands.

Melia azedarach.description: Also known as Chinaberry, this tree spreads aggressively and displaces native species.

Mikania micrantha.description: A highly invasive vine that climbs and chokes other vegetation; known as 'mile-a-minute' weed.

Mimosa pudica.description: Famous for its touch-sensitive leaves, this plant can spread aggressively in disturbed soils.

Mirabilis jalapa.description: Also called four o’clock flower; a garden escapee that naturalizes and spreads rapidly.

Muntingia calabura.description: A fast-growing tree with sweet fruits; spreads easily via birds and disrupts native plant regeneration.

Passiflora foetida.description: An invasive passionfruit vine with sticky fruits; smothers small plants and hedges.

Pistia stratiotes.description: Commonly known as water lettuce; a floating aquatic weed that blocks sunlight and reduces oxygen in water.

Portulaca pilosa.description: A succulent groundcover that spreads easily in dry areas, often outcompeting native species.

Punica granatum.description: Known as pomegranate, it may become invasive in some tropical areas if not managed.

Raphanus sativus.description: Wild radish; can naturalize quickly and compete with native vegetation in disturbed soils.

Sonchus oleraceus.description: A fast-spreading annual herb that competes with crops and is hard to control once established.
